name: Connie Smith
text: Sometimes you tend to be nervous when it comes to getting taxes done. Though, my experience started rocky, due to my place of my appointment, no one was there. I definitely will recommend Jackson Hewitt to others for tax services.

Please ask your family and friends about Eric's great tax services, and we look forward to seeing you next tax season. Sonja, Jackson Hewitt Care Team

name: Skye Stop
text: I have been filing for 5 years and the last two years they wouldn't give me a cash advance why I made 6 grand.plus they didn't give the second stimulus check until 45 day after everyone else

resp.text:
Thank you for sharing your honest feedback, though I'm sorry to hear of your disappointment regarding the refund advance amount decision made by our underwriter Metabank. It's never our intent to let you down, and though we're not privy to the reasons for their decision, you will have a letter from them with more details within 30 days of your visit. MetaBank considers criteria such as identity verification, IRS repayment history, current status of child support, student loans, tax liens, etc. in factoring their decision, as well as the estimated size of your anticipated tax refund.

Though this explanation may not resolve your frustration, I hope it helps to shed light on the process. If there are any additional concerns you'd like to discuss, please give us a call at 800-234-1040, as we want to ensure any issues are addressed with the attention deserved, and if needed, escalated to the appropriate team to best be of service. We appreciate the review, and look forward to your call if we can further assist. - Jen, Jackson Hewitt Care Team

name: Kelly Ratcliff
text: My fiance and I decided to use this office for his taxes for the 2017 year because we thought they might be able to find him more tax breaks.  Well, they did however, we were definitely scammed!  After seeing that they wanted to charge over $500 for preparing his taxes, the ladies then quickly said they could take off $200 of that price.  We weren't happy with it but since they had already inputed everything we said ok.  So he signed everything and we THOUGHT everything was fine and dandy.  We didn't bother to look at the paperwork when leaving because the women assured us that they had given him a discount.  Well, I go to pick up his check and BOOM...they still charged the OUTRAGEOUS fee!  What the heck?????  After calling and questioning both the manager (who was there that day) and the owner, they still refused because he signed the paperwork...even though they told us it wouldn't be that price.  Guess what folks?! SCAMMERS!  Go get your taxes done SOMEWHERE ELSE!  DO NOT FALL FOR THIS PLACE!!!!!!!!

resp.text: Hello Kelly, oh no! Please have your fiance give us a call at 800-234-1040 as this is never what we want to hear. We would like to look into this further for him.

text: The only reason I gave them one star is beacuse you have to leave one to leave a Review. name: Iceeu (Sonshine)
text:
I had to give a star to review Mr. Parker. My. Parker is the Accountant for my neighborhood's H.O.A. I was relatively new to the neighborhood just buying my home 2 years prior to investigating the H.O.A. I was unable to get any financial information from the only board member so I went to Mr.Parker.
His Secertary was so kind and very helpful and I appreciated that. She told me Mr. Parker was not in the office after returning from an office. I asked her some questions and she went back and forth to the same office with answers to the question's. I them saw a man comes from the office leaving and got on the elevator headed down. I know this today to be Mr.Parker, as she walked past the man was wearing a T-SHIRT advertising his business Bryan L. Parker Accounting. I later sent him emails requesting his presence at our Association meeting, I never received a reply.
I realize that all of this blame doesn't lie solely at Mr.Parkers feet, it lies equally at his feet and that of our Association President's feet. I received contradictory answers for questions I asked. As a homeowner I and my neighbors pay a fee to Mr. Parker and as an employee he should have been able to answer everyone of my questions and he did not. It is my opinion and the opinion of many of my neighbors that Mr. Parker made no effort to assist us with any information at all at several different requests and times. To us that is shady behavior.

resp.text: This post appears to have some misunderstandings. First of all, whoever was seen walking past, if you were told I was not in the office, was not me. We do not have t-shirts advertising our business so I would question if you were even at our office, since you have inaccurate information. Secondly, we are not employees of the HOA, we are contracted by the HOA board to handle certain accounting functions and provide the board with requested reports. Similar to any business, the reports are disseminated from the top (HOA) to those who need to know. Privacy laws are very strict and we try to adhere to them diligently. If you want more access to information of your HOA, I suggest you become a member of the board. As I understand it, several requests have been made for more board participation but thus far there have been no takers. If you become a board member, we would be glad to share appropriate information with you.

Is requiring me to submit to robo calls and unwanted emails just to file my taxes against the law?
Update. After all is said and done guess what? I didn't have to sign away my right to being contacted for marketing purposes by third party affiliates just to file my taxes. Jackson Hewitt just wants you to believe that you have too. My taxes have been filed, late but filed.
Read what your signing folks or companies like Jackson Hewitt will slip in unnecessary documents for their financial gain

resp.text:
Hello Brian

Thank you for choosing Jackson Hewitt!  We enjoy working with you and understand your concerns about third parties.  Due to Federal Regulations we need your signature to file your taxes with the IRS and to utilize a third party financial institution to ensure you receive your refund as fast as possible.  Further as a valued customer we will provide you with dates of our popular Refund Advance and Office openings for the tax season.

You are more than welcome to opt out of the notifications, however we cannot file taxes without a signed agreement for us to share your info with a third party AKA the IRS.

I hope this helps clear things up for you.  Please feel free to call us with any other questions you have at 800-234-1040

Best regards,
Sara
Jackson Hewitt Care Team

text: I’ve been using Thompson Tax Jackson Hewitt for the past 7 years or so and even though I work out-of-town throughout the year, I’ve continued using them until now! I called the office and they told me to submit whatever the IRS was asking for in the letter and to call them back if I received anymore letters or coorespondates . Fast-forward 6 months, 25 letters & 2 warnings, I never received any help from Thompson tax; I sent numerous emails and phone calls but no one in the office was really trying to solve my issue or take accountability in resolving my audit. I was recently in town for a weekend and dropped by the office. The secretary that was in that day said she had no clue about a audit guarantee or what I was even talking about. I ended up talking to one of the tax guys and he informed me it would probably just be best if I paid the almost 5 figure amount they were requesting. resp.text:
Thank you for your feedback, Hope, though I apologize if there was any miscommunication regarding how the costs for this year's filing services would be deducted. It is our policy to deduct the costs of tax prep from whichever return (federal or state) is received first when the costs are deducted from your refund vs paid for up front at time of service. Regarding your anticipated refund, the quickest and most accurate source for updates on your federal refund status will continue to be the IRS 'Where's My Refund' tool available here: https://www.irs.gov/refunds

If it's been over 21 days since the IRS has accepted your return, and their 'Where's My Refund' tool doesn't reflect an updated status, we recommend reaching out to them directly for the most accurate update on your refund. They are available 7am-7pm EST Monday - Friday at 800-829-1040, though please note that hold times appear to be shorter for those calling earlier rather than later in the day. I hope the information helps to clarify on the time frame for processing, though please give us a call at 800-234-1040 if we can address any additional questions or concerns, we value the opportunity to be of service. - Jen, Jackson Hewitt Care Team

name: Cristobal Du Mont
text:
Warning: Do not do business with this man!

I am currently a Senior at UAB and paying semester to semester out of pocket. Due to my many responsibilities, I have simply not had the time to focus on my taxes this year. My family has been doing business with Mr. Mccay for many years now. My grandparents gave me confidence, albeit misguided, that he would help take care of my taxes.

I first contacted Mr. Mccay via phone on Jan. 21st, then send him all the information he needed through e-mail. On Jan. 26th, I reach out to him as he has not replied or even confirmed he has received my information. It turns out that he had not even opened the documents. On Feb. 3rd, he finally reaches back out to me asking for more information which was answered immediately. A whole month had passed until I had to ask him for a second time to confirm if he had received my e-mail. His reply: "Find someone else to do your return."

This man was negligent, disrespectful, irresponsible, and financially detrimental to my situation this semester. I wish I had gone to some one else sooner.

name: Joe Shiver
text: They prepared our taxes. They put the wrong social on some paperwork but not all so the return got kicked back. I was able to get passed that. Once Re-submitted I followed up via email asking if they had re-mailed our amended return also. No response. Called after a month (now over 3 months after they initially did the return) and figure out that they had not mailed out amended return in the first place. Horrible communication and feel like just another customer that they could care less about.

resp.text:
Mr. Shiver,

My name is Rachel Byers and I am one of the Partners here at Byers, Byers, and Associates P.C.  First and foremost, I am very sorry you had a bad experience with our firm. We strive to provide high quality and outstanding service to our clients. We sincerely apologize for any miscommunications. In the extremely rare event that we have an unhappy customer, it is our policy to have a partner that was not involved in the preparation of your tax return review your file. As such, I have been selected as the ‘Monitoring Partner’ for your case.

After review, I have a clear understanding of your situation and wanted to provide some insight into a few things. As you can imagine, there are occasions where hand-written figures can be read incorrectly. Sometimes a 1 looks like a 7 or a 4 looks like a 9. This happens. When we release a return to be E-filed, each SSN on the return has to match the SSN and associated name in the IRS database. If it does not, we get a rejection notice from the IRS (and the associated State) letting us know why it was rejected. We make the quick correction to the digit and re-release the file for electronic acceptance. This is usually a very quick and painless fix. Unfortunately, your situation hit a small speed bump in that process. The State of Alabama accepts electronically filed returns, but only as a “piggy back” to the federal return. That is, we have to release the state return with the federal return. When we received the rejection from the IRS about the social, we immediately reviewed the tax documents provided to see if we could identify the error and found the issue. Without hesitation, we corrected the number and re-released the return. However, it seems we did that too quickly for our software. Since the state had not officially ‘rejected’ the original return we submitted, it did not allow another submission to the state until that happened. The state rejection came a few hours after we re-released the return. We were unaware the corrected state filing was never received by the state E-filing system. This has NEVER happened to us before. When it was uncovered that the state filing had not been accepted, we reached out to our software developers for guidance and they quickly fixed the issue and the problem was resolved.
I sincerely apologize for the delay in processing your return. This truly was a unique situation that we had not faced and have spoken with out software developers about it.

As it relates to your amended returns from a prior year, it seems that there was a miscommunication somewhere. We prepared the returns and provided all preparer signatures, filing instructions, and pre-addressed envelopes. Since amended returns have to be paper filed, they require physical signatures from the preparer, taxpayer, and spouse. We typically offer to mail the returns for a client if they are able to sign the returns when they pick them up. However, since I was not there and our front office manager is no longer with us, I cannot comment on what was advised when the amended return was picked up. Based on your discussion with the preparer about having the envelopes attached to the preparer-signed returns in your possession and our priority mailing records, it doesn’t appear that we mailed that return for you. I am VERY sorry for any miscommunication related to this. Rest assured, we will discuss communicating clear instructions to clients at our next team meeting.

Again, I apologize you had a bad experience. I did want to take a moment to thank you for your professionalism and character. Every staff member that had communications with you said that you were very nice and cordial. I know how frustrating financial matters can be, and it says a lot about you and your character that you maintained your professionalism. So, thank you for that.
We wish you the best of luck in all your future endeavors and would be happy to work with you again.

Best Regards,
Monitoring Partner at BB&A
